Thanks for you understanding. Hope you can resend the pull request after we move to `apache/skywalking`. Make sense?

Thanks for you understanding. Hope you can resend the pull request after we move to apache/skywalking. Make sense?

Coverage decreased (-0.2%) to 22.578% when pulling **c17f955d9409316aa19a627cd5e9dbc927484b9e on ascrutae:feature/support-grpc-future** into **8607844b20ba35f99a4f4afc6c7ad46d70293cbb on OpenSkywalking:master**.

# Announcement:

## SkyWalking has been accepted as an incubator project by Apache Foundation. All pull requests can't be accepted until Apache/SkyWalking repository established.
@wu-sheng Because postgresql plugin not working in my env. same as #580 . so, True jdbc is better that mybatis

@wu-sheng Not all time ,but sometimes does.
Skywalking ver v3.2.5.Call chain: web->dubbo->db, common scenario.

Yes, you are. And because of compiling and class loader problems, you will find out, you must make sure the log implementation and all dependencies must be inside agent. So no one will call it, except the agent itself.
After I implemented a Log Resolver, how does LogManager pick it up? Since JUL is a build in logger for JDK, will you consider use it so there is no classloading issue?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/14579419/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/14579419)

Coverage decreased (-0.2%) to 22.578% when pulling **8d9ea103b16c058f200f9b2985dc5f4b5a1069c7 on ascrutae:feature/support-grpc-future** into **8607844b20ba35f99a4f4afc6c7ad46d70293cbb on OpenSkywalking:master**.
Colse this issue

@zone1511 Sorry for delay. Apache stuffs take me a lot of energy in these days. 

> After I implemented a Log Resolver, how does LogManager pick it up? Since JUL is a build in logger for JDK, 

After you implement the LogResolver, you must change the initial codes by calling `LogManager#setLogResolver`. I would recommend you to do that by adding a static block in `LogManager`.

> will you consider use it so there is no classloading issue?

If you are using all JDK codes, it will not trigger classloader issue. But if your application is also using JUL, the logging config will be influenced. That is why we only use our own implementation, rather than any other log components.
@minlingchao1 I am closing this issue, since we have the same issue in English. Check #642
@minlingchao1 Pay attention at here, when you want to know the progress.
Closing this issue. The new **Core data structure** has been accepted. And 5.0 will base on that.
@peng-yongsheng @hanahmily Several days are gone. There is no objective opinion comes out. Do we agree to use GraphGL-API between collector and UI?
@chanwu79 We still need a demo to check what is happening. Can you provide one? Otherwise we have to ignore this issue. This issue will stay in open in next 7 days.
Closing this. Since this question stays cold in more than one month.
Try to solve this in 5.0
Already done.
Already provided. I think.
Support to enhance a class by multi plugins. So I am closing this issue. If other things come up, please submit a new issue.
Already provided. Please test it before release.
@WillemJiang Do your team still have people on doing this?
I assume this feature wil be provided by GraphQL-style Collector-QUERY APIs
@ascrutae Kafka plugins stays in optional-plugins for 0.9. Kafka 1.0 has attachment, I think.

@hanahmily said:

@wu-sheng, Could the service alerts merge into alert trend graph?

@hanahmily said:

I agree with that. There will be two lines in the trend chart. One for the number of application/instance/service and another for the alert in that dimension. Obviously, We need to make trend charts for the three dimensions above

@wu-sheng said:

> There will be two lines in the trend chart. One for the number of application/instance/service and another for the alert in that dimension.

I assume the number is about throughput? 

>  Obviously, We need to make trend charts for the three dimensions above

1. The pure application level is hard to say, it is required or not.
1. The application instance level is needed, by throughtput of all applications is a huge number. Or we just need alterting trend in this level.
1. Service throughput (All) == Application thoughput (All) == Application instance throughput (All) . So when you design throughput trend, please be carefully what is your actual purpose of that trend charts.
Closing this, because this is gone in 3.2.6 . Maybe fix by accident, I guess.

@wu-sheng congrad for moving the project into apache.

if you extend those standard JUL logger then you can attach a configuration which config the agent's logger log to your JUL logger implementation and other applications which use  JUL will not be affected.

> congrad for moving the project into apache

Thanks. But the moving is still on going. Something is not right so far.

> if you extend those standard JUL logger then you can attach a configuration which config the agent's logger log to your JUL logger implementation and other applications which use JUL will not be affected.

If they know JUL configuration well. you definitely can. So here is my proposal, if you are interested in JUL so much, I welcome you provide implementation by using JUL, and allow people to use config(file/system properties/sys env) to switch it.

But pay attention about some `LogManager#getLogger` execute before SnifferConfigInitializer, maybe you can't override those logs by now.
@myoss Modify the js file named main.js in src/main/resources/static catalog.  Delete line: urlArgs: "r=" + (new Date()).getTime()
我是直接用你们提供的 skywalking-web.tar.gz 解压部署的，这要在哪里修改？为啥本地启动 ui 就没有这个问题

@myoss Js file loaded timeout. 
This code: urlArgs: "r=" + (new Date()).getTime() led to the cache of browser useless.
我去掉了 `skywalking-ui/src/main/resources/static/main.js` 里的 `urlArgs: "r=" + (new Date()).getTime(),`，重新打包部署后，看浏览器的网络请求，好像和之前没有太大区别，现在只有少数情况下会出现之前的问题了。大神能否解释下，不甚感激啊
@myoss The main.js you modified not work.  The url still contains r=time about jquery, vue, head.....
Clear browser history
好的，这个暂时解决了，我在用用看，多谢。 另外一个问题，点击“exception“的trace记录，堆栈信息显示不错来，js报错。是不是堆栈信息内容太长了？ ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6986459/33929130-4e3ef81a-e023-11e7-824a-0d97e9703fce.png)

Rename to apache causes this, again.
anyone doing this req?
@clevertension Not yet. If you are interesting, feel free to do. Just please let us know.

Thanks for your suggestion.  Please use English since your comments are documented by ASF. Chinese is not a good way, sadly. :(

Besides the prefix of table name (not a technical problem), I have concerns about sharing the same ES cluster with other system. Because SkyWalking give ES a lot write-load, unless target systems are simple(doubt that), do we recommend people to do such things? @apache/skywalking-committers
With collector side support, I will do the adjustments as soon as the ASF repo is ready. Sadly, it is still not...
The elasticsearch database provide sharding index. Unless you want to use relation database such as mysql.

> The elasticsearch database provide sharding index. Unless you want to use relation database such as mysql.

@myoss Please ignore this, I think @peng-yongsheng misunderstand your point. This is about distinguishing tables only.
i want to use in elasticsearch ...
This version is not published, You can use the 3.2.6 version.

Sorry, I misunderstand the word distinguish as distributed.

#### I don't recommend every one to share database.
* 1 The collector will write huge data into db, so other systems will be affected.
* 2 The size of the es cluster is different between skywalking and other systems, this will makes it difficult to expand the cluster.

> This version is not published, You can use the 3.2.6 version.

@myoss , But still @ascrutae is saying the right things. Tag/Release 3.2.6 is the right choice to use. Maybe you can't find it for now, because ASF INFRA make some mistakes about setting this repo. Please wait one or two days, I suppose.
@myoss Please check this: #676 . @ascrutae is already trying to fix this.
@wu-sheng The matcher match the first argument is enough. I just check the `RealCall` class in version 3.x. This class have only one constructor and the first argument is `OkHttpClient`.

@alex8224 For making this issue resolved, I recommend you to provide the segments about this traceid. That is the only chance to find out what is happening. We will keep the issue open at least 7 days for you.

> The matcher match the first argument is enough. I just check the RealCall class in version 3.x. This class have only one constructor and the first argument is OkHttpClient.

@ascrutae If this is the only constructor, why use `any()`?
I am not sure that if this class would be changed in the next version since the newest version is 3.9.1

> I am not sure that if this class would be changed in the next version since the newest version is 3.9.1

Whether or not, you can't guarantee anything about other teams, right. So I recommend you to make sure all existed 3.x versions work in this version.
@wu-sheng  yeah. you are right. I had changed the constructor matcher to `any`, maybe the `any` matcher will more faster.
it's ok
which version are you used？
This is an issue If you use the `5.0-2018-prevision` version. and I try to fix it in PR #678.
